ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwàʼne fóo mbwó mèŋ Pɔ̂ɔ gẅie Ssé la kwoŋ kwoŋ ńtsɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́ɔn ńdɔg ńgÿo ngàŋntúm Yěsô Keleto. Peg fɛ̌ wege Timotê ŋweʼé yɔɔn ŋwàʼne, ńnáa mbwó Cúʼtè pʉ̀a Ssé á tÿǒsoŋo Koléŋtò. N gǐŋ ńŋweʼe ńnáa mbɔɔ mbwó pʉ̀a Ssé metsèm pie ée na shÿó Akaye ntsèm.
en: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by God’s will,   and Timothy  # 1:1 1Th 3:2; 1Tm 1:2 our  # 1:1 Lit the brother:

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto ne ńcÿó gʉm gí, ńne ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè na pi!
en: Grace to you and peace   from God our Father  # 1:2 Mt 5:16; 11:27; Lk 11:13; Jn 8:42; Eph 5:20 and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Pege ná ndǎg mbwó Ssé, á Tá pà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wégè Yěsô Keleto gẅie letsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a fóo pɔ́ né yé, letoonté wɔ́b, á fóo pɔ́ né yé.
en: Blessed be   the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies  # 1:3 Heb 10:28 and the God of all comfort.  # 1:3 Lk 2:25

ngiemboon: À tóonte wégè ngwòŋ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm gẅie pege ée tsɛ̀ɛ cʉanò, légwɔ́ gie pege yégè ge kuʼu létóonte petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ cʉanò, é cʉ́ʼʉ létóonte wɔ́b, é tóonte na ntí gie Ssé ka tóonte wégè yégè.
en: He comforts us in all our affliction,   so that we may be able to comfort those who are in any kind of affliction, through the comfort we ourselves receive from God.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ pege ne ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ tɛʼ, páʼ Keleto la gyá yé ngɔ́ʼ tɛʼ la, e Ssé giŋé ńne ńtóonte wégè tɛʼ ńcʉa na Keleto.
en: For just as the sufferings   of Christ  # 1:5 Rm 8:17; 2Co 4:10; Gl 6:17; Php 3:10; Col 1:24 overflow to us, so also through Christ our comfort overflows.  # 1:5 Php 1:29

ngiemboon: Peg lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ cʉanò, mbà pi ge zẅɛ́ʼ, e Ssé cʉa mǒ, ńtóonte gẅí, pi kě ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ na mánzsè Ssé. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie Ssé ne tóonte wég, mbà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńkẅiŋte gẅí, púʼu, pi kuʼu léshÿɔg fʉ̀ʼ gie ntí ngɔ́ʼ gie e ne ńkúu wég, e kǔu gẅí gí.
en: If we are afflicted,   it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which produces in you patient endurance of the same sufferings that we suffer.  # 1:6 Php 1:29

ngiemboon: Á gʉa fʉ̀ʼ gie peg ne ńkwaŋte gẅí, peg kwàʼ ńzsé ngie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ peg le gẅí pɔ́g, á nue peg ne ńzsé ngie, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ pi ne ńgyá gí ngɔ́ʼ la, e Ssé gíŋe ne ńtóonte gẅí gí páʼ peg.
en: And our hope   for you is firm, because we know that as you share  # 1:7 Phm 17 in the sufferings, so you will also share in the comfort.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌, peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi zsé ntí cʉanò gie á ka cʉa wég fʉ̀ʼ gie peg laa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Áziya, peg la gyá ngɔ́ʼ wó gyǎ tà metʉ̀ még mag, peg cʉ́ʼʉ ńjúʼu ńgee pɔ́ ńkwéte.
en: We don’t want you to be unaware, brothers and sisters, of our affliction that took place in Asia.   We were completely overwhelmed #— #beyond our strength  # 1:8 Ac 8:10; 1Co 15:24; Eph 1:21; 1Pt 3:22  #— #so that we even despaired  # 1:8 2Co 4:8 of life itself.

ngiemboon: Kwàʼ peg yég la zẅíŋ ngie mé záb ngie mé ge zẅéte wég, á cʉa púʼu, peg te gíŋ ńkwaŋ ngie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ peg lé twó ség gíŋ ńkuʼu légÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, peg cʉ́ʼ ńgẅiin yég pɔ́ lényé wég ngwòŋo nò ntsèm mbwó Ssé gẅie à zime mepfó na legwé.
en: Indeed, we felt that we had received the sentence of death, so that we would not trust in ourselves but in God   who raises  # 1:9 Mk 9:27; Jn 2:19 the dead.

ngiemboon: Peg laa ncwò legwé, yé zɔ̌ kẅé wég, à ge gÿo gíŋ kẅé wég tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mengʉ̀ngʉ̀. Áa nénʉ́ peg kwaʼ ńne ńzsé ngie à ge gÿo gíŋ kẅé wég tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mengʉ̀ngʉ̀,
en: He has delivered   us from such a terrible death,  # 1:10 Mt 10:21; Jn 8:51; Php 3:10 and he will deliver us. We have put our hope in him that he will deliver us again

ngiemboon: é gwaa kẅé wég, agí pwó gwɔ́ mǒ, ńtí nue pi ne sẅíŋte yé na twó ség. Páʼ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne sẅíŋte yé na twó ség la, à ge gÿo cÿó gʉm yég, é ne tóonte wég, à gwɔ́ púʼu, epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn e ná yɔ́b ndǎg mbwó Ssé na twó ség.
en: while you join in helping us by your prayers. Then many will give thanks on our   behalf for the gift that came to us through the prayers of many.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na weg leneŋé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, mbà yég mmó gie peg lɔg ńkaʼte, áa páʼ peg gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á fóo mbwó Ssé. Peg te ne fʉte tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́, peg ee pashwóŋ pʉ̀a nò lé ntʉ́m Ndʉalʉ̌a, mbùm yeg neŋé shwóŋo wég púʼu. Áa páʼ peg la gÿo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Peg la te lɔg pɔ́ zsénò pʉ̀a mesoŋ tá ńdɔg ńnéŋe púʼu wɔ́. Peg la lɔg pɔ́ páʼ Ssé ne ńcÿó gʉm yég, ńkẅéte wég, tá ńdɔgɔ ńnéŋe.
en: Indeed, this is our boast: The testimony   of our conscience  # 1:12 Heb 13:18 is that we have conducted ourselves in the world, and especially toward you, with godly sincerity and purity, not by human wisdom  # 1:12 Pr 3:19; 1Co 1:21 but by God’s grace.  # 1:12 Ac 23:1; 2Co 4:2; 5:12; 1Th 2:10

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá peg te ŋweʼe tsɔ́ mmó tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne é ná né pi, á gwɔ́ yendyɛ̀ʼɛ na nò gie pi tǒŋ ńjúʼ wɔ́, n kwǎŋ ngie pi ge pú júʼ tà cʉ́me.
en: For we are writing nothing to you other than what you can read and also understand. I hope you will understand completely #— #

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi ka zye léjúʼ ntí nyìŋ gẅie n gee yé la, á ge láʼa lyɛ̌ʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto tǒ, n gwaa gwɔ́ mbwó pi é gwɔ́ gí mmó kàʼte, pi gíŋ ńgwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn mmó kàʼte.
en: just as you have partially understood us #— #that we are your reason for pride,   just as you also are ours  # 1:14 2Co 9:3; Php 2:16; 4:1; 1Th 2:19–20 in the day of our  # 1:14 Other mss omit our Lord Jesus.  # 1:14 Php 1:6

ngiemboon: N ka ne ńzsé ngie á ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu. Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo tá mèŋ faʼa lévɔg ńcʉa mbʉ̀a pi, tá ńgÿo ńgíŋ ńcʉa, ńzsé ngie n ge gÿo pi kág kág ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a.
en: Because of this confidence, I planned to come to you first,   so that you could have a second benefit,  # 1:15 Other mss read a second joy

ngiemboon: N ka ne ńkwaŋa légwaa gʉa Masenduwane ńcʉa láʼ pi, ḿbiŋ fó Masenduwane ńgíŋ ńtó né láʼ pi, pi kẅéte wɔ́ɔn légʉa tà ńkúu Jẅindê,
en: and to visit you on my way to Macedonia,   and then come to you again from Macedonia and be helped by you  # 1:16 Ac 20:38 on my journey  # 1:16 Ac 19:21; 1Co 16:5–7 to Judea.  # 1:16 Lk 1:5

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie n kɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo légÿo púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ḿmaʼa pɔ́ kwàŋ la? Kà pi kwǎŋ ngie n cʉ́ʼʉ légɔɔn nò gie n ge gÿo, ńdɔg pɔ́ legye nyìŋ mesoŋ ńgɔɔn, tà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ n gɔɔn ngie «oon» ńgíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie «ngǎŋ» pɔ́ fʉʼó?
en: Now when I planned this, was I of two minds? Or what I plan, do I plan in a purely human  ,# 1:17 Php 3:3; Col 3:22 way so that I say “Yes, yes” and “No, no” at the same time?

ngiemboon: «Ngǎŋ!» Á gʉa na nò gie peg ka shwóŋo gẅí, peg ka te zẅíŋe nò ḿbiŋ ńdʉʼ wɔ́. E Ssé ne ńzsé.
en: As God is faithful,   our message to you is not “Yes and no.”

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn páʼɔɔn nue Yěsô Keleto, Míŋ Ssé gẅie peg Silásè, mbɔɔ Timotê ka shwóŋo nò yé mbwó pi, à la te tó ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie «ngwɔ́ á gɔɔn nò, ḿbiŋ ńkúbe» wɔ́. À la tó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ «nyìŋ gẅie à gɔɔn nò, à te kúbe.»
en: For the Son of God,   Jesus Christ, whom we proclaimed among you #— #Silvanus,  # 1:19 Or Silas; Ac 15:22–32; 16:19–40; 17:1–16,# 1:19 1Th 1:1 Timothy, and I #— #did not become “Yes and no.” On the contrary, in him it is always “Yes.”  # 1:19 Heb 13:8

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo ngie kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Ssé la kaʼ wɔ́ɔ, à pumte. Púʼu, pege lɔg lezíŋ sé, ńgɔɔn ngie «aamɛn», ńdɔgɔ púʼu, ńnáa mekùʼ mbwó Ssé.
en: For every one of God’s promises   is “Yes” in him. Therefore, through him we also say “Amen”  # 1:20 Ps 72:19; Rv 22:21 to the glory of God.  # 1:20 Mk 10:37; Lk 9:32; Jn 17:24; 2Co 3:18; 2Pt 3:18

ngiemboon: Kwàʼ Ssé zɔ gÿo tá peg ne ńtʉte tʉte nzèm Keleto, tà mbɔɔ pi. À la faga wégè,
en: Now it is God who strengthens us together with you in Christ, and who has anointed   us.

ngiemboon: ńcÿɔʼɔ liŋé yé na pege, ńnéŋe Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ntʉ́m pege. Á lɔg ńgwɔ́ ndùŋmvfò mmó na shúm sie à ge náa mbwó pege.
en: He has also put his seal on us and given us the Spirit in our hearts   as a down payment.  # 1:22 Eph 1:14

ngiemboon: Pi cʉ́ʼ mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí mmó gie á ka gÿo tá n te gíŋ ńtóo láʼ pi á Koléŋtò wɔ́, n ka te ne ńkwoŋo légÿo pi júʼ kékáŋ wɔ́. N gɔɔn páʼɔɔn éshwóŋo nò. N dɔɔn ńcÿɔɔ nò, e Ssé zẅé wɔ́ɔn.
en: I call on God as a witness,   on my life, that it was to spare you that I did not come to Corinth.  # 1:23 1Co 4:21; 2Co 13:2,10

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńzsé ngie, agẅi lézáb ntʉ́m na Yěsô Keleto à tʉte, peg těen faʼa létó ésẅɛ́ɛ gẅí, ńzáb páʼ pi ge gÿo wɔ́. Peg tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ létó ńkẅéte gẅí pi mege ńjúʼ mboŋó.
en: I do not mean that we lord it over your faith, but we are workers with you for your joy, because you stand firm in your   faith.
